title: [jit] Slicing a tensor list always creates a tensor that requires_grad
body_html:
Repro:

import torch
x = torch.randn(3)
y = torch.randn(4)
@torch.jit.script
def fn(x, y):
    lst = [x, y]
    return lst[1]

fn(x, y)
fn.graph_for(x, y)

# Output
graph(%x : Float(*)
      %y : Float(*)) {
  %2 : int = prim::Constant[value=1]()
  %lst : Dynamic[] = prim::ListConstruct(%x, %y)
  %4 : Dynamic = aten::select(%lst, %2)
  return (%4);
}

DynamicType's requires_grad field is always set to True...
